userreviews.userReview: As usual I didn't pay anything for this book but I'll still be abundantly blunt below.The nutshell on this one is that it's a collection of four short stories (about 25 minutes total reading time) that focus on the rather grizzly paranormal. You've got some zombies, a poltergeist and an impish carnivorous spirit.To the positive, the author covers a wide range of villains and portrays them very well. The book is solidly written and the stories move along at an extremely rapid pace.To the negative, the whole thing lacks depth. Considering the reading time the price on Amazon is outrageously high. These are less stories than the are very small vignettes into particularly gruesome situations. It's as if they were dashed off in a day and sent to publication. They're so short that there's no time for any real tension to build for the reader.In summary, there's potential for this author but this particular collection seems a bit small to be sold on its own.

"Boo! Great Spooky Stories"It's now October ... the month to celebrate Halloween with multiple ghost stories to shiver your timbers! These stories are about escape or death, hiding from flesh eating zombies, being hunted by an ex-spirit partner, and more. Reading these stories will enlarge your eyes, raise your blood pressure, and not allow you to sleep. Enjoy them ... Halloween only comes once a year ... right? These could be fun to read aloud at a small party or around a campfire; just don't let anyone run away into the dark!
